record.author: POLLEX 2000 (Bruce Biggs & Ross Clark), David Addison
record.notes: This is an amalgamation of North (MRQ) and South Marquesan (QMS) Pollex supplemented from Dordillon 1931-1932
record.problems: This is an amalgamation of North (MRQ) and South Marquesan (QMS)
record.classification: Austronesian, Malayo-Polynesian, Central-Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Oceanic, Central-Eastern Oceanic, Remote Oceanic, Central Pacific, East Fijian-Polynesian, Polynesian, Nuclear, East, Central, Marquesic

record.annotation: Dos, echine, se mettre dos a dos (Dln)
Accoutume, habituee, fait a, avour l'habitude de, etre accoutume (Dln)
Baiser, faire toucher nez contre nez (Dln)
=baked (either in an umu or a modern oven).
cook in general e.g. nunu te kaikai = cook the food
Etre debout, se tenir debout, droit (Dln)
Female (I don't understand why this is treated as a suffix - MW)
The male of mankind and of all birds. A husband (Crk)
Terre, propriete, domicile, richesses, manoir, foyer domestique
Frame to which thatch is tied
Pieces of thatch are called hatu, but the only reference I've heard for this is in relation to the hame of (F)Hatu 'Iva (the southernmost MRQ island). Thatch is extremely rare on NH today.
to shoot(also NH word for firearm and to blow [breath out])
Morceau de bois pointu pour percer les poulpes (Dln)
Donner des petits coups avec la main (Dln)
Donner des petits coups avec la main (Dln)
Strike (in flaying skin or bark), strike, nudge with elbow (I)
Mort, la mort, mourir, souffrir, malade, malaise, maladie, mal (Dln)
Die (of a person), go out (of a light) (Dln)
Tailler, ciseler, travailler le bois ou la pierre (Dln)
dull in modern NH, most likely derived from the word for donkey (after French burique), and hence metaphorically stupid, dull
to fall (in the sense of becoming unbalanced, slipping)
to fall in the sense of an avalanche or rock slide
Probable arch. form - as dogs were lost in the Marquesas by the time the Europeans arrived.
Huile noiratre qui decoule de lama (Dln)
Lime de peau de certains poissons (Dln) [<]
the endemic Marquesan biting black fly
(German nono) the sand fly purportedly introducted by a freighter unloading ballast with sand (and eggs) from PGN (then a German colony? or just "German" because of its ferociousness?)
Froid, coup de sang, avoir froid (Dln)
Incendier, bruler, mettre le feu a quelque chose (Dln)
to light a fire (or lamp); by extension turn on an electric light
Red, applied to feathers, cloth etc. imported to the islands,also to the scarlet berries or peas used in their ornaments (Crk)
Nuit, tenebres, jour de vingt-quatre heures (Dln)
Location in space; to, in, into, on. beside, near, at, or to the home of (Mtu)
Originally two hundred or four hundred but now one hundred (Bgs).(Source: Pollex)
